title: Items appear in list on Orientation Change
body:
When I perform this sequence of events, items in list appear:
1.        Click on Urgent Calls
2.        Click on Enable Urgent Calls
3.        Click on Call Filter
4.        Click on Prefixes
5.        Press on Menu Button
6.        Click on New item
7.        Click on OK
5.        Orientation Change

title: Toasts appear on Device Rotation
body:
When I perform this sequence of events:
1.        Click on Urgent Calls
2.        Click on Enable Urgent Calls
3.        Click on Call Filter
4.        Click on Prefixes
5.        Orientation Change
 Undesired Toast appears.

title: Checkbox changes value on Device Rotation 2
body:
When I perform this sequence of events:
1.        Click on General
2.        Click on Profiles
3.        Press on Menu Button
4.        Click on New item
5.        Click on OK
6.        Insert text "A"
7.        Click on OK
8.        Press on Menu Button
9.        Click on New item
10.      Click on OK
11.      Insert text "B"
12.      Click on OK
13.      Check A
14.      Orientation Change
 The checked box becomes unchecked.

title: Checkbox changes value on Device Rotation
body:
When I perform this sequence of events:
1.        Click on Urgent Calls
2.        Click on Enable Urgent Calls
3.        Click on Call Filter
4.        Click on Prefixes
5.        Press on Menu Button
6.        Click on New item
7.        Click on OK
8.        Click on Back Button
9.        Click on Prefixes
10.      Check the checkbox
11.      Orientation Change
 The checked box becomes unchecked.

title: Dialog Disappears on Device Rotation 5
body:
When I perform this sequence of events:
1.        Click on General
2.        Click on Password
3.        Orientation Change
 The dialog on screen disappears.

title: Dialog Disappears on Device Rotation 4
body:
When I perform this sequence of events:
1.        Click on Urgent Calls
2.        Click on Enable Urgent Calls
3.        Click on Call Filter
4.        Click on Prefixes
5.        Press on Menu Button
6.        Click on New item
7.        Orientation Change
 The dialog on screen disappears.

title: Dialog Disappears on Device Rotation 3
body:
When I perform this sequence of events:
1.        Click on Urgent Calls
2.        Click on Enable Urgent Calls
3.        Click on Call Filter
4.        Click on Date/Time
5.        Click on Choose Date And Time
6.        Click on New Range
7.        Orientation Change
 The dialog on screen disappears.

title: Dialog Disappears on Device Rotation 2
body:
When I perform this sequence of events:
0.        (Scroll Down)
1.        Click on How To Uninstall
2.        Orientation Change
 The dialog on screen disappears.

title: Dialog Disappears on Device Rotation
body:
When I perform this sequence of events, right after the installation:
1.        Click on Urgent Calls
2.        Click on Enable Urgent Calls
3.        Click on Skip if Vibrate
4.        Orientation Change
The dialog on screen disappears.

title: a java.lang.NullPointerException bug
body:
Hello,
we recently tested your app by an automated Android GUI testing tool developed by our team, and here is the suspicious code snippet:
![screen shot 2016-04-13 at 2 05 06 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14055020/14484201/e54764be-0180-11e6-83a5-b72e27ae507e.png)
Here is the logcat:
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012): FATAL EXCEPTION: main
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012): Process: a3e.process, PID: 4012
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012): java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{cri.sanity/cri.sanity.screen.VibraActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2209)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2258)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at android.app.ActivityThread.access$800(ActivityThread.java:147)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1211)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:136)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5135)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:795)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:611)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012): Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at cri.sanity.PrefActivity.on(PrefActivity.java:104)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at cri.sanity.PrefActivity.fullOnly(PrefActivity.java:119)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at cri.sanity.PrefActivity.fullOnly(PrefActivity.java:113)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at cri.sanity.screen.VibraActivity.onCreate(VibraActivity.java:21)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5361)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1087)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2163)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4012):    ... 11 more
Could you please take a look and confirm this bug? Thanks a lot!
ywm0822 AT gmail DOT com

title: suggestion: temporarily turn off call blocking
body:
Hiya, love the app, paid for it. Huge respect for your approach to financing a GPL project.

Sometimes I'm expecting a call, it'd be handy to turn off call blocking temporarily, say for 20mins or something.

Apologies if it's already there and I just haven't found it.

title: option to overwrite silent mode when someone is insisting
body:
When you receive repeated calls from the same number in a short period of time, and you forgot the phone on silent mode, it may be a good idea to let the phone ring for the second or third calls onward (maybe just for selected contacts).

http://www.reddit.com/r/androidapps/comments/1on27v/question_is_there_an_app_that_will_unsilence_my/

title: Remove dependency on Market / Google Play
body:
I used F-Droid to get this application and do not have the Google Market / Google Play installed. As a result I have no way to 'donate' in order to unlock the additional functionality required for recording phone conversations longer than two minutes.

I'd rather not fork, but am prepared to do so.
